data.title: Roark :: Our Team
data.text:
Paul joined Roark in 2020. Prior to joining Roark, Paul spent 14 years in investment banking; the vast majority of this time was spent at Barclays, where he covered various sectors, including consumer / retail, healthcare, business services, industrials, and technology. During that time, Paul worked on M&A and financing transactions across much of the Roark portfolio. Prior to that, Paul worked at SunTrust Robinson Humphrey in the Consumer Group. Paul received a BBA in Finance and Real Estate from the Terry College of Business at the University of Georgia.

Neal founded Roark in 2001 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. In addition to his responsibilities as Managing Partner, Neal is most actively involved in Roark’s investments in Inspire Brands, Driven Brands, GoTo Foods and Primrose Schools, and was previously the Chairman of the Board of Roark’s prior investment in Wingstop. Prior to founding Roark, Neal was Co-Founder and CFO of U.S. Franchise Systems (“USFS”). Neal helped transform USFS from one brand with 22 hotels in nine states to three brands with more than 500 hotels in 50 states and five countries, making USFS the tenth largest hotel company in the United States. Prior to founding USFS, Neal was a Principal of Odyssey Partners, L.P., a private investment partnership founded by Jack Nash and Leon Levy. Prior to Odyssey, Neal was a Principal and General Partner at Acadia Partners, L.P. (now Oak Hill Partners) and subsequently a Managing Director of a successor company, Rosecliff Inc. Neal began his career in the corporate finance department at Drexel, Burnham, Lambert Incorporated. Neal received a B.A. from Lehigh University.

Stephen joined Roark in 2005 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. In addition to his responsibilities as General Counsel and Managing Director, Stephen is actively involved in the execution of all Roark investments, financings, recapitalizations and sales. Prior to joining Roark, Stephen was a Senior Vice President and General Counsel of USFS. While at USFS, he was also co-manager of Constellation Development Fund, LLC, a hotel investment vehicle. Stephen received a J.D. from the University of Chicago and a B.A. from Lehigh University. Stephen is a member of the Georgia Bar Association.

Coates joined Roark in 2021. Prior to joining Roark, Coates worked as a Senior Associate within PwC's Finance Management Consulting practice and as an Associate in PwC's Capital Markets Accounting Advisory Services (CMAAS).

Coates received his Master of Science in Accounting and Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of Georgia. He is a Certified Public Accountant.

Justin joined Roark in 2024. Prior to joining Roark, Justin was an Associate Partner at McKinsey & Company in its global retail and consumer operations practice working with clients on supply chain, procurement, sustainability, and operations topics. He began his career in investment banking and corporate development. Justin received a Master of Business Administration from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a Bachelor of Science in Finance and Public Policy from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.

Sabrina joined Roark in 2018 upon graduating with an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She serves on the board of directors of Mathnasium and is actively involved in Roark's investments in Primrose and The Cheesecake Factory. While completing her MBA, Sabrina worked at Amazon in the Retail Leadership Development program. Prior to business school, Sabrina worked at Goldman Sachs in New York, where she was a Vice President in the Equity Synthetic Products group. Sabrina received a B.A. in Economics from Stanford University.

Jason joined Roark in 2018. Prior to joining Roark, he spent eight years at KPMG, most recently as a Director in KPMG’s Strategy group, focusing on operational strategy and transformation initiatives. For the ten years prior to KPMG, Jason owned and operated two retail furniture franchises in the Atlanta area. Jason received an M.B.A from the University of Georgia and a B.S. in Psychology from the University of Florida.

Tommy joined Roark in 2012. He serves on the board of directors of Jim 'N Nicks, is actively involved in Roark's investment in Installation Made Easy and previously worked on Roark's prior investments in Solterra, Quala, GFL Environmental and Waste Pro. Prior to joining Roark, Tommy worked as an investment banking analyst at Harris Williams & Co. in the Diversified Industrials Group, where he focused on middle-market mergers and acquisitions across a variety of sectors. Tommy received a B.S. in Business Administration from the Kenan-Flagler Business School at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Roanne joined Roark in 2021 and is a member of Roark's Investment Committee. She was formerly a Partner at Hellman & Friedman in San Francisco, where she focused on improving the value creation plans and operational efficiency of that firm's portfolio companies. Before joining Hellman & Friedman in 2017, Roanne spent over 12 years in Boston, London and Johannesburg with Bain Capital, where she was an Operating Partner. She has served on the boards of the Edcon Group, formerly South Africa's largest non-grocery retailer, and the French home furnishings and decor company Maisons du Monde. Prior to Bain Capital, Roanne was a consultant at McKinsey & Company, a correspondent and editor for Thomson Reuters and an investment banker at Morgan Stanley. She received an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School and a B.A. from the University of Virginia.

Allison joined Roark as Chief People Officer in 2020. Allison is a Human Resources executive with over twenty years of experience and a successful track record of helping team members reach their potential. Allison joined Roark from Aptean, a private-equity backed global provider of mission-critical ERP, Supply Chain and Compliance solutions. At Aptean, she was Chief Human Resources Officer and a member of the senior executive team, responsible for developing and executing human resources strategy in support of the overall business plan. In that role, she oversaw, coached and developed thirty HR professionals across five countries and was responsible for HR related M&A activities for multiple carve-outs, add-on acquisitions, and an overall change of ownership.

Previously, she was the Chief People Officer at Jabian Consulting, a management and technology consultancy. Allison started and spent the majority of her career at Accenture in various strategic and operational HR roles, including Managing Director, Human-Resources - Business Process Outsourcing.

Allison received her BBA in Marketing and International Business from the University of Texas at Austin.

Will joined Roark in 2019. Will has more than 12 years of experience across the consumer and retail industry. Prior to joining Roark, Will was a Director in KPMG’s Corporate Strategy practice, focusing on growth strategy, customer experience, business process improvement and post-merger integration for clients in both the private and public markets. While serving as a Corporate Strategy advisor, Will assisted his clients by aligning financial, business and operating models to craft and execute successful strategies. Will received a B.S.B.A. in Information Systems Management from Auburn University.

Andy joined Roark in 2023. He has over 25 years of experience leading and advising on complex global transactions, strategic initiatives, and transformational programs. Prior to joining Roark, he was a Managing Director with Accenture and a Partner at EY where he worked on Private Equity and Corporate transactions. He was also a member of the management team of a private equity backed business services company. Andy received an M.B.A from Emory’s Goizueta Business School and a B.A. from Mississippi State University.

Dennis joined Roark in 2022 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. He was a Partner and Head of the Consumer Private Equity practice at Ares Management, where he was responsible for sourcing and executing investments in private companies in the consumer goods, consumer services, e-commerce, retail, restaurant, leisure and lodging sectors. Prior to joining Ares in 2006, he worked at UBS Investment Bank, where he participated in the execution of a variety of transactions including leveraged buyouts, mergers and acquisitions, dividend recapitalizations and debt and equity financings. Dennis serves as a Trustee and Treasurer of The Center for Early Education.

Dennis received a B.S. from Virginia Tech in Electrical Engineering and an M.S. from the University of California, Los Angeles in Electrical Engineering.

Allison joined Roark in 2019. Allison currently serves as Chief Social Impact & Content Officer, developing and leading Roark’s initiatives related to diversity and inclusion, philanthropic giving, community service & engagement, as well as creative content. She is also a member of Roark’s Responsible Investment Committee. Prior to joining Roark, Allison served on the Executive Team at Miller’s Ale House as the Vice-President of Marketing. Prior to that, she held global and domestic brand and marketing roles with The Coca-Cola Company and Sprint, as well as developing and launching two start-up concepts in the retail and restaurant industries. Allison received an M.B.A. and a B.S. from Cornell University, where she served a six-year appointed term on the President’s Council of Cornell Women to advance and champion women. She currently serves on the Board of The Michelle McGann Fund, which advocates for diabetic children and Eat Laugh Give, which assists families with food insecurity and related needs.

Geoff joined Roark in 2010 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. He serves on the board of directors of and is actively involved in Roark’s investments in Jim ‘N Nick’s, Massage Envy, Miller’s Ale House and Nothing Bundt Cakes. Geoff was involved in Roark’s prior investments in Wingstop and FastSigns. Geoff is a past board member for the National Restaurant Association and served as a Trustee and Chair for the National Restaurant Association Education Foundation. Prior to joining Roark, Geoff was the President of Cinnabon, a division of GoTo Foods. Prior to serving as President of Cinnabon, Geoff had responsibilities for franchise sales, real estate, design and construction and franchise administration for all of GoTo Foods. Prior to GoTo Foods, Geoff was Vice President of USFS, managing franchise sales and development for Microtel Inns and Hawthorn Suites in the Western U.S. Geoff started his career with the Bristol Hotel Company, a large hotel owner and operator, where he held roles from Director of Sales to General Manager. Geoff received a B.A. from The Cornell University School of Hotel Administration.

Kevin joined Roark in 2019 and is a member of Roark's Investment Committee. He serves on the board of directors of and is actively involved in Roark's investments in Pet Valu (TSX: Pet), PartsTown, Orangetheory Fitness, Self Esteem Brands, GoTo Foods, and Fitness Connection.

Prior to joining Roark, he spent 13 years with The Home Depot, his last role being President and Chief Marketing Officer, where he oversaw the strategy, sales, and operations of the company’s digital efforts. Concurrent with this role, he also served as the Chief Marketing Officer for The Home Depot, overseeing the strategic branding, marketing, and advertising direction of the company. Previously, he led The Home Depot’s Home Services businesses, the largest home services business in the country. Kevin joined The Home Depot in 2006 as a company officer, where he led technology teams focused on merchandising, stores, e-commerce, supply chain and the company’s international divisions.

Prior to joining The Home Depot, Kevin spent ten years with GE, where he held CIO and CTO roles in a number of GE businesses (Healthcare, Renewables, Energy and GE Global Research). He started his career and spent eight years with Dow Chemical working primarily in Plastics R&D and in Technology. Kevin received a B.S. in Computer Science from Central Michigan University.

Ben joined Roark in 2022 and is actively involved in Roark’s data science and advanced analytics initiatives. Prior to joining Roark, Ben worked as a Senior Manager of Data Science at Coca-Cola where he built scalable data science solutions supporting strategic decision making and back-office transformations across the enterprise. Prior to Coca-Cola, Ben worked as a Senior Scientist at Revenue Analytics where he built automated pricing and decision support tools across several industries. Ben received a Ph.D. in Industrial Engineering, a M.S. in Operations Research, and a B.S. in Aerospace Engineering from the Georgia Institute of Technology.

John joined Roark in 2008 and is the Committee Chair of Roark's Responsible Investment Committee. He also serves on the board of directors of Fitness Connection, is actively involved in Roark's investment in Orangetheory and previously worked on Roark's prior investments in Solterra, GFL Environmental, Peachtree Business Products, Quala and Waste Pro. Prior to joining Roark, John was a Senior Associate in the transaction advisory services group at Ernst & Young. John received a Master of Accountancy and a BBA from the Terry College of Business at the University of Georgia.

Mark joined Roark in 2013. He is actively involved in Roark’s investments in Divisions Maintenance Group and Nothing Bundt Cakes. Prior to joining Roark, he was a Senior Associate in the transaction advisory services group at Ernst & Young, where he focused primarily on business valuations. Prior to that, Mark worked in the Audit and Assurance Advisory Services group at Ernst & Young. Mark received an M.S. in Accountancy from the Carroll Graduate School of Management at Boston College and a B.S. from Auburn University. Mark is a CFA Charterholder.

Claudia joined Roark in 2019. Her legal responsibilities focus primarily on working with the portfolio companies on a wide range of operational and legal matters, including best practices and risk management. She also participates in Roark transactional, compliance, regulatory, and corporate governance matters. Prior to joining Roark, Claudia was Executive Vice President & Chief Legal Officer for Hooters of America, LLC where she was responsible for all legal matters, human resources, training, payroll, benefits, and risk management. Prior to Hooters, Claudia served as Chief Administrative Officer and General Counsel to Huddle House, Inc. where she managed the legal, real estate, and human resources departments. Before going in-house, Claudia was a commercial litigator in Washington, DC with Ginsburg, Feldman and Bress. Claudia received her B.A. from Pitzer College of the Claremont Colleges and her J.D. from George Washington University’s National Law Center. Claudia is a member of the Bar Association of the District of Columbia.

Jason joined Roark in June 2006. Prior to joining Roark, Jason owned and operated Lifeline Technology Services, a provider of network and IT consulting services to small- and medium-sized operations in the Atlanta area. Jason is responsible for telecom, networking, IT infrastructure and cybersecurity at Roark. Jason is an active member of InfraGard, International Information Systems Security Certification Consortium, and is a Certified Information Systems Security Professional. Jason was nominated for the 2014 Georgia CIO of the year award by the Georgia CIO Leadership Association.

Martin joined Roark in 2014. He is actively involved in Roark's investment in Driven Brands and previously worked on Roark's prior investments in Wingstop and Solterra. He also serves on the board of the non-profit Agape Youth and Family Center and as a Teaching Director for the Roark Investment Fellowship, a BLK Capital program. Prior to joining Roark, Martin worked as an investment banking analyst at Harris Williams & Co., where he focused on mergers and acquisitions across a variety of sectors. Martin received a Bachelor of Science in Accounting and Business Administration from Washington and Lee University.

Erik joined Roark in 2007, is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee and currently serves as the Chief Investment Officer. He has spent more than 20 years in private equity where he primarily focused on multi-location, consumer-oriented businesses. Prior to joining Roark, Erik was a Partner at Grotech Capital Group, a private equity firm based in Baltimore, MD. Prior to joining Grotech, Erik worked in the investment banking division of Deutsche Bank and its predecessor entities, BT Alex. Brown, and Alex. Brown & Sons. Erik received a B.S. from the Kenan-Flagler School of Business at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.

Bert joined Roark in 2020 and is a member of Roark’s Responsible Investment Committee. Prior to joining Roark, Bert was Vice President of Logistics and Commercial Excellence at Vulcan Materials Company. While at Vulcan, Bert led Procurement, Rail Logistics, Truck Logistics, Logistics Innovations and Commercial Excellence, helping them build industry-leading capabilities across the materials supply chain. Prior to that, Bert worked at McKinsey & Company, working with clients on supply chain, procurement, strategy, sales and marketing and other operational areas. Bert received an M.B.A. from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a B.A. in English from Washington and Lee University.

Ian joined Roark as Managing Director and Chief Analytics Officer in 2021. Ian is a technology investor and entrepreneur. Prior to joining Roark, Ian co-founded Two Six Capital, one of the first investment and operating firm using data science to create an advantage in the private equity investment and value creation process. Two Six Capital was acquired by West Monroe in 2020.

Ian also co-founded and was the sole investor in several ecommerce companies, including Bergine LLC (acquired by Gilt Groupe). Prior to that, Ian spent more than a decade in private equity and venture capital, investing across a wide range of industries with Technology Crossover Ventures, Vanguard Ventures and Telesoft Partners. Ian began his career at Morgan Stanley in private equity and investment banking groups.

Ian received an M.B.A. from The Wharton School and a B.A. in Engineering and Economics from Dartmouth College.

Sunil joined Roark in 2024. Prior to joining Roark, he held various leadership positions at Verizon Business and EY’s Technology Consulting practice. Prior to that, he worked at Toyota Motor Europe and the John Lewis Partnership (UK). Sunil currently serves as a Board Member for Illinois Business Consulting, part of the Gies College of Business at Univ. of Illinois. Sunil received a Master of Business Administration from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and a Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering from Coventry University (UK).

Lancelot joined Roark in 2016. Prior to Roark he served as the IT Administrator, and later, IT Network Manager of Caribbean Alliance Insurance Company over a seven year period. He holds certifications from Cisco, Microsoft & CompTIA. He brings over 10 years of general IT knowledge and experience to the team. Lancelot is responsible for Help Desk services, Telecommunication Systems, Mobile Device Management and IT Infrastructure services at Roark.

Steven joined Roark in 2008 and transitioned from Managing Director to Senior Advisor in November 2019. He is on the board of directors of GoTo Foods and Inspire Brands. Steven is the former Chairman of the International Franchise Association. Prior to joining Roark, Steven was CEO of GoTo Foods. Prior to becoming CEO of GoTo Foods, Steven served as President of Carvel Ice Cream. Under Steven's leadership, GoTo Foods acquired Cinnabon in 2004, Schlotzsky's in 2006, and Moe's Southwest Grill in 2007. Prior to his tenure at GoTo Foods, Steven was President and COO of USFS. Steven helped grow USFS from one brand with 22 hotels in nine states to three brands and more than 500 hotels open in 50 states and five countries. Prior to joining USFS, Steven was a Vice President at Holiday Inn Worldwide. There, he was responsible for franchise services, support, and training for 1,700 hotels in the United States, Canada, and the Caribbean, operating under the Holiday Inn and Crowne Plaza brands. He also led franchise sales, and during his tenure, Holiday Inn increased its franchise sales from 60 in 1991 to 300 franchises in 1995. From 1988 to 1991, Steven held various positions with Days Inn of America. Steven received a B.A. from Tufts University.

Greg joined Roark in 2018 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. Prior to joining Roark, Greg was Managing Director, Global Head of Restaurant Coverage and Head of Southeast Region at Barclays. Prior to Barclays, Greg was at Credit Suisse from 2006 to 2014, where he was a Managing Director responsible for covering clients in the consumer and retail industry and was the head of the Restaurant Investment Banking sector. In his duties at Barclays and Credit Suisse, Greg worked across much of the Roark portfolio as a trusted advisor and lead provider of debt and equity financing in the capital markets. Prior to joining Credit Suisse, Greg was a Managing Director at RBC Capital Markets from 2001 to early 2006, and at Prudential Securities from 1994 to 2001, covering the consumer products and retail industry. Greg received a B.S. in Business Administration from Bucknell University.

Sarah joined Roark in 2019 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. She serves on the board of directors of GoTo Foods, CKE and Nothing Bundt Cakes. Prior to joining Roark, she was the President and CEO of Coffee & Bagel Brands, which comprises Einstein Bros. Bagels, Caribou Coffee, Bruegger’s Bagels, Noah’s New York Bagels and Manhattan Bagel Company. She joined Coffee & Bagel Brands as the President of Einstein Bros. Bagels in 2015. Prior to Coffee & Bagel Brands, Sarah served as Executive Vice President in the Portfolio Group at Bain Capital, where she partnered with leadership teams at consumer and retail brands (including Bloomin’ Brands, Dunkin’ Brands and Michaels Arts & Crafts) to build and execute growth strategies across all functions of the business. Prior to Bain Capital, Sarah was the Director of Strategy at The LEGO Group in Denmark. She started her career at McKinsey & Company in Washington, D.C. Sarah received an M.B.A. from Stanford’s Graduate School of Business and a B.A. from Princeton University.

Kyle joined Roark in 2022. Prior to joining Roark, he was a Controller at RFA Management Company, a large single-family office in Atlanta. Previously, Kyle also worked as the Controller for Brown Integrated Logistics, a private equity backed company headquartered in East Atlanta. Kyle began his career in public accounting, starting off in financial statement audit at Grant Thornton and then worked in EY’s M&A consulting group.

Kyle received a Master of Professional Accountancy from Georgia State University and a B.S. in Finance from Bryan College. Kyle is a Certified Public Accountant.

Mike joined Roark in 2010 and is a member of Roark's Investment Committee. He serves on the board of directors of and is actively involved in Roark's investments in Divisions Maintenance Group, Driven Brands, Installation Made Easy, ServiceMaster Brands and Youth Enrichment Brands, and previously worked on Roark's prior investment in Atkins Nutritionals and Great Expressions Dental Centers. Prior to joining Roark, he worked at Montage Partners, a Phoenix-based private equity firm. Prior to Montage, Mike served as a Senior Associate at Kroll Zolfo Copper. Mike received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a B.A. from Pomona College.

Will joined Roark in 2024. Prior to joining Roark, Will worked for Everstream Analytics, Zero Grocery, and The Home Depot, where he used machine learning and data science methodologies to improve supply chain and operations. Will received a Master of Science in Computational Data Analytics from the Georgia Institute of Technology and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Information Systems & Operating Management and Finance from Emory University.

Brett joined Roark in 2016. He is actively involved in Roark’s investments in Inspire Brands and Culver’s. He also serves as the Program Director of the Roark Investment Fellowship, a BLK Capital program, and as a member of the Leadership Council for Junior Achievement of Georgia. Prior to joining Roark, Brett worked as an analyst at Robert W. Baird & Co. in the firm’s Consumer Investment Banking Group. Brett received a B.A. in Economics and Political Science from the University of Notre Dame.

Kevin joined Roark in 2021 upon graduating with an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He is actively involved in Roark's investments in Divisions Maintenance Group, Mathnasium and Self Esteem Brands. Prior to business school, Kevin worked at Norwest Equity Partners, where he was a Senior Associate. Prior to Norwest Equity Partners, Kevin worked at Lazard, where he was an Analyst in the Middle Market Advisory group. Kevin received a B.A. in Mathematics and Economics from Northwestern University.

Emilia joined Roark in 2020. She is a tax professional with previous experience in Big Four public accounting, specializing in partnership and REIT taxation. Prior to joining Roark, she worked as a Tax Manager at Ernst & Young.

Emilia received a Bachelor of Science in Commerce degree with a double major in Accounting and Finance from DePaul University. She is a Certified Public Accountant.

David joined Roark in 2019 and is a member of Roark’s Investment Committee. Prior to joining Roark, David was a Managing Director at Robert W. Baird & Co., where he was Co-Head of Baird’s Global Financial Sponsors Group and a member of the firm’s Investment Banking Management Committee. He served as Roark’s primary coverage officer and was a lead partner on several of Roark’s investments and exits. Prior to joining Baird in 1995, David spent five years at Coopers & Lybrand, primarily focused on corporate finance and mergers and acquisitions advisory assignments. David received a B.S. in Accounting from Valparaiso University.

Dan joined Roark in 2023 after working as a Summer Senior Associate in 2022. Prior to joining Roark, Dan worked as a Private Equity Associate at The Carlyle Group and as an Investment Banking Analyst at BMO Capital Markets. Dan received a B.S. in Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering from Rice University and an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.
